questions.question: What is the main advantage of Auto Loader over manual file processing scripts?
options: Incremental processing - only processes new files since last run
questions.correctAnswer: Incremental processing - only processes new files since last run
questions.explanation: Auto Loader tracks which files have been processed and only loads new files, making it highly efficient for continuous ingestion. Manual scripts typically re-scan entire directories.

questions.question: What does schema inference do in Auto Loader?
options: Automatically detects column names and data types from sample files
questions.correctAnswer: Automatically detects column names and data types from sample files
questions.explanation: Schema inference analyzes a sample of files to automatically determine the schema (column names and types), eliminating the need to manually define schemas for JSON/CSV files.

questions.question: What happens when Auto Loader encounters a new column in incoming data?
options: With schemaEvolutionMode='addNewColumns', it automatically adds the column
It throws an error and stops processing
questions.correctAnswer: With schemaEvolutionMode='addNewColumns', it automatically adds the column
questions.explanation: Schema evolution allows Auto Loader to adapt to schema changes. The 'addNewColumns' mode automatically adds new columns to the target table when they appear in source files.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a checkpoint location in Auto Loader?
options: Stores processing state to enable exactly-once processing and recovery
questions.correctAnswer: Stores processing state to enable exactly-once processing and recovery
questions.explanation: The checkpoint location stores metadata about processed files and stream state. This enables Auto Loader to resume from where it left off after cluster restarts without reprocessing files.

questions.question: When should you use COPY INTO instead of Auto Loader?
options: One-time historical loads or simple batch ingestion
Large files that don't fit in memory
questions.correctAnswer: One-time historical loads or simple batch ingestion
questions.explanation: COPY INTO is ideal for one-time data migration or simple batch loads where you don't need ongoing incremental processing. Auto Loader is better for continuous, streaming ingestion.

questions.question: What file format does Auto Loader use internally to track processed files?
questions.explanation: Auto Loader leverages Delta Lake's transaction log to maintain exactly-once semantics and track which files have been processed, ensuring no duplicates or missing data.

questions.question: What does the 'cloudFiles' format refer to in Auto Loader?
questions.explanation: The 'cloudFiles' format is Auto Loader's streaming source that's optimized for cloud object storage, providing incremental processing, schema inference, and exactly-once guarantees.

learnings: Auto Loader incrementally processes new files
Schema enforcement catches data quality issues early
Schema evolution handles changing source schemas
